summary: Analytical problem-solver with both qualitative and quantitative skills. Extensive hands-on experience in the laboratory leading projects and managing client interactions. Experience in developing novel research methodologies and conducting data analysis to bring new pharmaceutical products to market. Expertise in life sciences technical skills and product development and commercialization. Accomplished in international business and industry relationship building.
geoRegion: New York, New York, United States

currentPositions.title: Senior Principal Scientist, Analytical Development at Prevail Therapeutics

projects.description:
•The objective was to establish a cell based bioassay for gene screening and idea testing needs.
•Using zinc finger nuclease technology, donor gene and zinc finger insertion was performed.
•Cell culture and transfection, flow cytometry and microscopy formed a heavy basis of the project.
projects.title: Development and Optimization of cell bioassay methods including transfection using smart delivery systems for gene targeting screening using ZFN.

projects.description:
The objective was to perform basic and applied studies to understand how RNA viruses interact with the host cell.
•BMV is a positive strand RNA model system virus and a plant protein, glycine rich protein (GRP), is hypothesized to be coencapsulated in the virion. The project deals with characterizing the presence of  GRP and the role it plays in the life cycle of BMV.
•GRP is known to be acting as an RNA chaperone and plays a role in plant innate immune defense.
projects.title: Copackaging of Brome Mosaic Virus (BMV) with a host factor

projects.description:
•Evaluated the existing hip navigational market and developed market positioning  for Zimmer iAssist Hip by identifying its differentiation and recommending a promotional strategy.
•Competitive Landscape involved companies like Stryker, Aesculap, Omni LifeScience and Carnegie Mellon.
projects.title: Market Positioning Strategy for Zimmer iAssist Hip

projects.description:
• Won the 1st place prize with a cash prize, $1200. 
• Developed a reasonable best case commercialization path for a portion of EmotEd’s intellectual property. EmotEd, LLC, an IU startup, is developing a therapeutic video game designed to help patients with emotional deficits resulting from neurological disorders. 
• Illustrated the competitive landscape, value proposition, business model and the risks involved with the launch of a new project in a young industry.
projects.title: Development of a business model and execution plan to launch EmotEd

organizations.name: Focus St Louis
organizations.description: The Focus St. Louis Women in STEM leadership program was a 5-week program where the top 40 applicants were selected. The program hosted women with various STEM disciplines were other women in leadership positions came and mentored and various tops such as diversity, emotional intelligence, and teamwork were covered. This was a great opportunity to expand and improve leadership skills for program participants.
organizations.position: CORO Women in Leadership program participant

organizations.name: American Cancer Society- St. Louis section
organizations.description:
Relay for Life (TM) is an annual event organized by the American Cancer Society in St. Louis for cancer patients and survivors. Survivors take a celebratory lap, with the crowd cheering them on. The caregivers are also involved and are recognized for their support to the loved ones. 
The Event Leadership team is involved with planning out the event, entertainment, and activities.

location: New York, New York, United States

publications.name: Orthogonal LC-MS Workflows for the Characterization of Therapeutic Antibody Glycosylation
Characterization of Antibody Deamidation using Orthogonal methods- Imaged Capillary Isolectric focusing and LC-MS/MS
publications.description: Presented successful correlation of the unusual charge variant profile with deamidation using peptide mapping. The test IgG samples displayed iCE profiles with an unexpected shift to increased acidic variants. Further, the test sample electropherograms appeared unusually heterogeneous, whereas the acidic species for the reference molecule appeared well defined.

publications.name: A Rapid and Simple Proteomics Digestion Protocol
publications.description: We identified conditions allowing for rapid trypsin digest at elevated temperatures that yielded reliable, reproducible results in less than 2 hours on a wide variety of substrates. Introduced the Rapid digestion buffer which helps with digestion in 2 hours yielding results similar to traditional overnight digestion.

publications.name: Using Cation Exchange Chromatography Mass Spectrometry (CEX-MS) for iCIEF Charge Variants
publications.description: Charge variant analysis is critical for characterizing and monitoring the quality of therapeutic antibodies. Charge variant isoforms arise from modifications including deamidation, N-terminal pyroglutamate, sialylation, antibody fragmentation, and C-terminal lysine clipping. These acidic and basic charge variants can be critical quality attributes impacting function or safety of therapeutic antibodies. In the biopharmaceutical industry, imaged capillary isoelectric focusing (iCIEF) is widely utilized for routine profiling of antibody charge variants. Although iCIEF remains a high-resolution technique for analyzing charge-based heterogeneity, the technique does not allow for identification of observed variants. Here we present successful reproduction of an iCIEF charge variant profile on a cation-exchange chromatography platform and utilize on-line mass spectrometry for assignment of antibody isoforms associated with each charge variant feature.

commentary.text: Congratulations, Anindya! All the best in your new adventure!
